column1: {{disambig-two|the extension of the [[Greenway]]|the road of [[Beleriand]]|[[Old South Road (Beleriand)]]}}

column2: was the name of the extension of the North Road (later Greenway) beyond [[Tharbad]] and into [[Enedwaith]].<ref name=gen>[[General Map of Middle-earth]]</ref>

column1: It formed the great '''[[North-South Road]]''' that once led to [[Gondor]].<ref name=utmap>{{UT|Map}}</ref><ref>{{UT|Index}}</ref> However several disasters that struck [[Eriador]] during the [[Third Age]]
column2: including the dissolution of [[Arnor]] and the abandonment of Tharbad
column3: made traffic between the former [[Two Realms]] scarce; the route was all but lost by the end of the [[Ages|Age]].<ref name=gen/>

column1: The name "Old South Road" appears only in the original [[General Map of Middle-earth]]
column2: as an extension of the Greenway to the south beyond Tharbad. After Tharbad
column3: its line is dotted and disappears
column4: suggesting (along with the name "Old") that it was perhaps ruined by the later [[Third Age]] and didn't go beyond Enedwaith. The road and the name also appears on [[Pauline Baynes]]'s ''[[A Map of Middle-earth]]''.

column2: [[Christopher Tolkien]] drew ''[[The West of Middle-earth at the End of the Third Age]]''. In that map he "restores" by extrapolating the whole course of the Great Road
column3: joining the interrupted lines.<ref>{{UT|IMap}}</ref> The label "Old South Road" disappears however
column4: and is replaced by the more general label "North-South Road"
column5: which refers to the whole restored route.<ref name=utmap/>
